text: Mahatma Kabir is a 1947 Indian Kannada-language film directed by R. Nagendra Rao. He also stars in the lead role alongside Subbaiah Naidu. The film deals with Mahatma Gandhi's vision of harmony between the Hindus and Muslims. It was set in the backdrop of the religious violence in India that took place after the Independence from the British rule. ==Cast== * R. Nagendra Rao * Subbaiah Naidu * Lakshmi Bai * Kamalabai * M. G. Mari Rao * H. Ramachandra Shastry ==Reception== The Indian Express called the film a "fine picture". The reviewer wrote, "The picture has [Rao's] best directorial touches in all the important sequences and the quality of photography, recording and costumes have aptly contributed for the good standard of the production." He further added, "Mr. Nagendra Rao deserves congratulations for his achievement in ably directing this in the most suitable way to tackle the present-day problems." ==References== ==External links== * Category:1940s Kannada-language films Category:Films about religious violence in India Category:Indian films Category:Indian black-and-white films
